Hi all,

I'm trying to use artifact build heritrix-1.5.1-200511011835.tar.gz on
a Solaris 10 (AMD64) machine using Java 1.5.0. On startup it never
"completes"... just and endless maching line of '.' while I wait.

heritrix_out.log, in its entirety, is:

Thu Nov  3 07:36:17 EST 2005 Starting heritrix
SunOS arachnophobia 5.10 Generic i86pc i386 i86pc
java version "1.5.0_01"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_01-b08)
Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (build 1.5.0_01-b08, mixed mode)
JAVA_OPTS= -Xmx256m
core file size        (blocks, -c) 0
data seg size         (kbytes, -d) unlimited
file size             (blocks, -f) unlimited
open files                    (-n) 256
pipe size          (512 bytes, -p) 10
stack size            (kbytes, -s) 10240
cpu time             (seconds, -t) unlimited
max user processes            (-u) 16357
virtual memory        (kbytes, -v) unlimited

HERITRIX_HOME and JAVA_HOME have both been set in my environment. I
modified bin/heritrix to explicitly reference bash, since the default
'sh' on Solaris isn't fully compatible.

I get the same behavior even if I set JMX_OPTS to the empty string.

Interestingly, Heritrix *is* running: I can connect to the WUI, setup
a crawl, and actuall perform one. But for whatever reason the dmesg
file isn't being written right away, or at least not detected. I don't
know if this is a shell issue or something else.

-- 
Tom Emerson                                          Basis Technology Corp.
Software Architect                                 http://www.basistech.com
